review: This works really well for Netflix and Youtube, but streaming from a browser has a little too much lag.  I love the option to stream from the browser, but it's pretty hard to watch when the mouths and audio are about 1 sec off.  It works with Netflix, Youtube, Google Play, and the browser.  I wish it worked with Amazon Prime and Hulu Plus too.  Hopefully, that comes in the future.Another big drawback is that I feel I was tricked into thinking it didn't need external power.  Notice how all the pictures of the Chromecast have a little port on the end?  That's where you plug in the power cord.  Not one single photo I saw had the cord showing.  You can plug it into the wall or a USB port, but it makes it a lot more cumbersome than originally advertised.I wouldn't buy this yet.  It seems to me that the Roku Stick has more options for streaming and doesn't need an external power source.  Although the Roku is $100 and the Chromecast is $35, I don't think the Chromecast compares yet.  Maybe when they support Amazon and Hulu.
author: Nicole Barney

review: I am in love with this device, I am a netflix member and my 2 yr old daughter can watch all her cartoons and shows on tv and I get to do my things on my laptop while she watches her show..If you have a subscription on netflix and use youtube then this is for you especially if you have a little one who loves to watch cartoons and movies..It's a reasonable price (me being a single mom and all) and I get use my laptop while the little one gets to watch her favorite stuff on tv. Also the device itself is so small and discreet you don't even see it..I love it!!
